steps.title: Fold the neck down once if you're going for a classic style.
steps.content: Fold the neck down once if you're going for a classic style. [1] X Expert Source Sahra Brandt Personal Stylist Expert Interview. 12 October 2021. This is most likely the look you think of when you consider turtlenecks. When you put it on, the neck will probably extend up to your chin or even over your mouth. Take the top of the neck and fold it down toward your chest so the top edge of the neck meets the collar. [2] X Research source Folding the neck gives your turtleneck a crisp, defined outline that makes it look more polished than if you scrunch the neck.

steps.title: Roll the neck over twice to make a shorter neckline.
steps.content: Roll the neck over twice to make a shorter neckline. If you feel like your turtleneck is strangling you or it feels like it's too high on your neck, fold the neck down twice so the top folded edge meets your collar. It also makes a short neckline that exposes more of your neck. [3] X Research source This is a great option if you're wearing a light turtleneck during warmer seasons, especially if it's also sleeveless.

steps.title: Scrunch the neck instead of rolling it down if you want a soft, loose look.
steps.content: Scrunch the neck instead of rolling it down if you want a soft, loose look. Some people argue that you should always fold your turtleneck down, but you might prefer leaving the neck extended. Bunch the fabric around your neck so it doesn't reach above your jawline. [4] X Research source This works best with lightweight turtlenecks or cowl turtlenecks that have a lot of loose, flowing fabric around the neck. Bunching heavy turtlenecks can add too much weight to your neck.

steps.title: Get a mock or cowl turtleneck to shorten the neckline without rolling the neck.
steps.content: Get a mock or cowl turtleneck to shorten the neckline without rolling the neck. Do you like the look of a turtleneck, but hate the feeling of it wrapping around your neck? Try a mock turtleneck that has a neckline that sits just above your collarbone or wear a cowl turtleneck, which has a looser, draped collar. [5] X Research source Mock turtlenecks come in a variety of weights so you can choose a lightweight one if you'd like to layer it or a heavy material if you want to wear it as a standalone sweater.

steps.title: Tuck in a turtleneck and wear a button-down shirt for a casual look.
steps.content: Tuck in a turtleneck and wear a button-down shirt for a casual look. Play around with layering your rolled turtleneck to create lots of outfit options. Wear a lightweight turtleneck and put on a button-down shirt, but don't button it to the top. Leave the collar open so you can see the rolled turtleneck underneath. [6] X Research source Don't match the color of the turtleneck with the button-down shirt since you want the turtleneck to be visible. Try a dark olive turtleneck with a lighter green button-down shirt or vice versa, for instance.

steps.title: Wear a thick, chunky turtleneck with corduroy pants for a warm style.
steps.content: Wear a thick, chunky turtleneck with corduroy pants for a warm style. Soft, bulky turtlenecks are perfect for cold temperatures since they really trap heat. However, since they are so big, plan on wearing them without other layers. It's totally fine to toss on a winter coat, but go for a peacoat or wool coat instead of a puffy coat, which could make you look too bulky.

steps.title: Style a knit turtleneck with pants or a skirt for a comfy look.
steps.content: Style a knit turtleneck with pants or a skirt for a comfy look. To make a casual but comfortable outfit, wear your rolled turtleneck with stylish trousers or tuck the top into a skirt. Go for a lightweight or medium-weight ribbed turtleneck since it's easy to dress up or down. This way, you can create lots of outfits from a basic wardrobe. [7] X Research source For example, wear an oatmeal-colored rolled turtleneck with tweed or plaid pants. Then, finish the look with loafers and a cardigan.

steps.title: Dress up a turtleneck to make it formal or evening appropriate.
steps.content: Dress up a turtleneck to make it formal or evening appropriate. Instead of wearing casual shoes, put on leather shoes, boots, or heels. Pair your turtleneck with a tailored blazer and trousers, a skirt, or dressy slacks. Don't forget to accessorize your look with stylish jewelry like a simple chain, earrings, or a stylish watch. [8] X Research source For instance, pair a pale pink turtleneck with a dark blue or gray blazer. Wear your favorite necklace or watch and you're all set!

steps.title: Choose monochromatic layers for a slimming effect.
steps.content: Choose monochromatic layers for a slimming effect. Most turtlenecks are form-fitting, so it's easy to feel self-conscious when you wear them. Fortunately, a few layers in monochromatic colors can actually streamline and elongate your shape. A classic example is pairing black trousers or a skirt with a black turtleneck and a black jacket. [9] X Research source You don't have to limit yourself to black! Colors like pale pink, light gray, or pale green also work well together and they're great for daytime or nighttime looks.

steps.title: Pair a turtleneck with a blazer or suit jacket for a professional look.
steps.content: Pair a turtleneck with a blazer or suit jacket for a professional look. If you're going for an easy everyday look or something you can wear to the office, put on a soft turtleneck and roll the neck. Tuck the turtleneck into the waistband of your pants and put on a fitted blazer, tailored jacket, or suit jacket to make your outfit look polished and put-together. [10] X Research source For example, wear a lilac-colored turtleneck with black trousers and a camel-colored blazer for a relaxed look, or wear a charcoal-gray turtleneck under a navy suit if you'd like something more professional.

steps.title: Wear a lightweight sweater or vest over a turtleneck for a warm style.
steps.content: Wear a lightweight sweater or vest over a turtleneck for a warm style. Instantly change the look of your turtleneck by putting another sweater or vest over it. Pick a piece that has a scoop collar so you don't hide the rolled turtleneck. [11] X Research source This is a really easy way to add your own unique style to the turtleneck. Going for a fun, boho vibe? Pick an oversized fuzzy vest. Want a studious, academic look? Wear a plain, crew-neck sweater with a pair of jeans.

steps.title: Toss a leather jacket over a turtleneck for an edgy, youthful vibe.
steps.content: Toss a leather jacket over a turtleneck for an edgy, youthful vibe. Who says turtlenecks have to be stuffy? Create an effortlessly cool style by pairing a rolled turtleneck with dark pants or jeans, and throw on a rich brown or black leather jacket. To finish your casual look, wear sneakers, or go for leather shoes or boots for a more polished outfit. [12] X Research source Try a black turtleneck with jeans and a black leather jacket if you're going for a rebellious vintage style, or dress up the look by wearing an ivory turtleneck with a dark brown leather jacket, and brown trousers.
